src: ARI : Hello . My name is ARI . Can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) LC : Um hello , okay , I think we need to find the rheumatology ward . # greet ( ) ; request ( location ( rheumatology_ward ) ) RP : Yes , I think that 's it . Ok , we 'll see if he can give us any information . # affirm ( ) ; request ( help ) [start] LC : Mhm . [MASK] RP : So do you want to ask him or do you want me to ? I 'll do it . RP : I 'd like to find the rheumatology ward . [MASK] ARI : You have to enter the second building behind you . Then it 's the second door on the left . [MASK] RP : Ok , he told us to go to the building behind us , it 's the second door on the left . He 's giving us directions . That 's handy . There you go . [MASK] LC : Ok. [MASK] LC : What time was our appointment ? [MASK] RP : So we have an appointment at 10.30 PM . [MASK] LC : Ok. [MASK] RP : It 's 10 PM just now so we have plenty of time . LC : Ok. [MASK] RP : We have time . LC : We 'll walk slowly . RP : We 'll walk slowly . LC : Yes . [MASK] RP : There 's no need to worry . RP : Ok , there you go , we 're in the ward . We need to ask where the reception for this ward is . [MASK] LC : Ok. [MASK] RP : Well that 's it , we 've arrived . LC : Ok . Very good . [MASK] RP : Do you want to ask him ? [MASK] LC : Ok. [MASK] LC : Um ... Where is the reception for the rheumatology ward ? [MASK] ARI : The reception is just behind me . Remember to take a ticket on your right . [MASK] LC : Ah ... [MASK] RP : Ok , thank you . [MASK] RP : So we 'll take a ticket . LC : Mhm ... [MASK] [end] RP : And then we 'll wait until we 're called . LC : Ok. Is there 's a waiting room ? # acknowledge ( ) ; request ( location ( waiting_room ) ) RP : Yes , there 's a waiting room just there . We can sit down . # affirm ( ) ; suggest ( sitting-down ) LC : Ok. # acknowledge ( ) RP : So you do n't get tired . LC : Ok. # acknowledge ( ) ARI : Thank you , see you later , have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )

src: RP : We 'll walk slowly , it 's ok . LC : Yes . # affirm ( ) [start] RP : Umm ... Where are the lifts ? [MASK] ARI : The lifts are at the entrance on the left . [MASK] RP : Ok. [MASK] [end] RP : We 'll take the lift then , it 'll be easier .

src: ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) RC : Hello ARI . # greet ( ) LP : I need to go to room 17 for treatment . So , I do n't know how to get to room 17 . # request ( directions ( room_17 ) ) RC : ARI , could you please tell us how to get to room 17 ? For a ... # request ( directions ( room_17 ) ) ARI : Yes . You continue along the building , take the lift and it 's on the second floor . # affirm ( ) ; inform ( directions ( room_17 ) ) RC : Ok. And is it on the left or the right ... on the second floor ? # acknowledge ( ) ; request ( location ( room_17 ) ) [start] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . You have to go to the reception . [MASK] RC : Ok . The reception is on the ground floor , is that right ? [MASK] ARI : Yes . Absolutely . [MASK] LP : Are we , are we expected in room 17 ? Is there someone who will see us or guide us ? RC : Yes , do you know if there is someone who will come and welcome us to room 17 ? And what paperwork do we need to provide ? ARI : I 'll call a nurse to find out . Sorry , I do n't have this information . [MASK] RC : Ok , thank you , I 'll wait for you to call the nurse then . [MASK] ARI : Yes . [MASK] RC : Can I sit somewhere with my husband while I wait ? [MASK] ARI : Yes . Of course . [MASK] LP : I have an appointment at 12.30 PM , is it going ahead ? I 'm not late or too early ? RC : Um , we have ... [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . [MASK] RC : I 'm the one you have to talk to because if not ... LP : I have an appointment at 12.30 PM . Will there be any delay ? RC : Um hello , we would like to know if there is a delay to welcome us to room 17 , we have an appointment in room 17 . ARI : No . [MASK] RC : Because we have another appointment later in another department . ARI : Yes . Of course . [MASK] LP : Do you know what type of appointment I have , is it an anaesthetist , a surgeon , who 'll inform me or something else or an examination ? RC : I did n't quite understand . [MASK] LP : Um , I have an appointment , is it , is it a treatment this time , is it a surgeon , an anaesthetist or a radiologist who 'll take ... [MASK] RC : Hello , are you able to tell me who is going to see us ? Is it an an anaesthetist , the surgeon , a nurse ? For this ... for this operation . [end] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . You have to go to the reception . # cant-help ( ) ; suggest ( going-to ( reception ) ) RC : Ok , thank you . # acknowledge ( ) ; thank ( ) ARI : Thank you . See you soon . Have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )

src: LP : Hello ARI . # greet ( ) ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) [start] LP : Ask how ... [MASK] RC : Hello . I 'd like to have a small meal , can you tell me where we should go ? [MASK] ARI : There are a few options available as part of your visit , and there 's also a cafeteria on the ground floor . [MASK] RC : Can you tell me when the cafeteria opens ? [MASK] ARI : From 11 AM to 4 PM . [MASK] RC : From 11 AM to 4 PM , is that right ? [MASK] ARI : Yes , you 're right . [MASK] RC : Thank you . [MASK] ARI : You 're welcome , I 'm here to answer your questions . [MASK] RC : Is the cafeteria wheelchair accessible ? Because my friend is in a wheelchair and he ca n't get around by himself . [MASK] ARI : Yes , absolutely . [MASK] RC : Thank you . [MASK] LP : Hmm , ARI , could you tell me how to get to the cafeteria ? [MASK] ARI : There 's a cafeteria on the ground floor , near the courtyard . [MASK] RC : ARI , could you tell me if my appointment is at 11 AM ? [MASK] ARI : Sorry , I do n't have this information . You have to go to the reception . LP : He might know how to get there . LP : Can you tell me how to get to the reception ? [MASK] ARI : The reception is just behind me . Remember to take a ticket on your right . [MASK] RC : Ah , thank you . [MASK] LP : It 's quite simple . Thank you ARI . [MASK] ARI : You 're welcome . I 'm here to answer your questions . [MASK] LP : It would be nice if we knew how to take the lift . LP : ARI , could you tell us how to get to the lift ? [MASK] [end] ARI : The lifts are at the entrance on the left . # inform ( location ( lifts ) ) LP : Do these lifts take us to the cafeteria , or do we have to take something else ? ARI : I 'm sorry , but I ca n't help you . # cant-help ( ) RC : Is the cafeteria on the ground floor ? # request ( location ( cafe ) ) ARI : Yes , you 're right . # affirm ( ) RC : So we do n't have to take the lift to get to the cafeteria ? ARI : No , you do not . # disaffirm ( ) RC : Thank you . # thank ( ) LP : Thank you very much ARI . # thank ( ) ARI : You 're welcome , thank you , see you later and have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )

src: ARI : Hello , my name is ARI . How can I help you ? # greet ( ) ; inform ( ari ( name ) ) ; offer-help ( ) [start] LP : Where can we eat ? [MASK] RC : ARI , the person that I 'm accompanying feels intimidated by by you , and and they 'd like to know where they can eat . [MASK] ARI : There 's a cafeteria on the ground floor , near the courtyard . [MASK] LP : Are there toilets ? And where are they ? [MASK] RC : I 'm asking on behalf of the person that I 'm accompanying , who is asking me , well , where are the toilets ? [MASK] ARI : Very easy ! You have to go to the corridor at the end of the room . [MASK] LP : Are they accessible by disabled people ? [MASK] RC : My ... My friend does n't walk very well , can he get into the toilets with his ... [MASK] LP : Wheelchair . RC : his wheelchair ? [MASK] ARI : Yes , absolutely . [MASK] LP : I have an appointment in room 17 , where is it ? [MASK] RC : And he 's a bit lost , he has an appointment , he 's been asked to go to , to go to room 17 . Could you tell us where to go , please ? [MASK] ARI : The examination room is on the second floor . You just have to go to the counter on the left and then a nurse will come and take care of you . The lifts are at the entrance on the left . [MASK] LP : Is it wheelchair accessible ? [MASK] RC : Is the lift wheelchair accessible ? Can he use the lift ? [MASK] [end] ARI : Yes , you 're right . # affirm ( ) LP : I have an appointment at 10 AM , how long ... ah well yes ... # incomplete-da ( ) RC : He has an appointment at 10 o'clock . Do you know if there is a waiting time , if he has time for a coffee or do we have to go straight to the treatment room ? # request ( clinic ( busyness ) ) ARI : No , there are n't too many people . The doctor will take you on time . # disaffirm ( ) ; inform ( clinic ( busyness ) ) LP : I do n't know ... # incomplete-da ( ) ARI : Thank you , see you around , have a nice day . # thank ( ) ; bye ( )
